Description: Shoulder sherd of North Ionian, possibly Clazomenian, pottery neck-amphora; exterior: glazed black on neck ring above band of tongues in added white with dots in interstices; below, six preserved rows of double outlined scales with white dots in the centre of each scale.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as Cairo CG26149. Cook points out that scales on vases were not only the work of the Clazomenians but also by others who were influenced by Clazomenian models.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 25, no. 29, pl. 9, no. 29)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.260, no.9a)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 143 note 102a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.599)
